Articles.Content: Have you tried more power?

And that, finally, is enough power.

Edited December 28, 2013 by Whackjob

...more power...

LOL

/thread
I take the NASA approach. "No go. No go."

The first time I had hooked up my joystick on a shuttle, it was a return mission with a little extra fuel.

"Time to lower the throttle <orientation reversed, throttles up to 100%>".

I then learned the true usefulness of the cut throttle key.

for me:

"Yes! I landed on the mun!"

1 minute later i get stuck in between 2 tanks, have to quickload into orbit, crash it so only the capsule survives and then quicksave...

"Oh god, not the launch tower again".

I kinda miss it.

'Moho still has an atmosphere...right'

'I bet I can do a flip'(actually have this one recorded)

'Let mechjeb drive'(was fine for the first hour then it went too fast)

'The ground looks awfully close'

'&*#@'

Edited December 29, 2013 by Spartwo

"What do you mean Parachutes don't work on Mun?!?!"

I've come a long ways
"It should be stable this time."
"Why isn't my fuel draining balanced?"

i was testing a emergency deorbit system so i decoupled everything pointed the ship forward and hit the srbs 2 seconds passed and i uttered this phrase,

"whats that debris coming at me at high vel-...oh ****"

the launch stage crashed into the capsule

Testing a Skylon-based SSTO is serious business when you have no idea how to set the landing gear.....

"Hey Stupid Skylon-based SSTO align whit the Runway... I SAID ALIGN *Then the whole plane goes to the left* NVM TAKE OFF TAKE OFF I SAID!!!! *Suddenly the poorly balanced weight on the wings start to make everything wobbly* NOOOOOO!!! *Crash*"

"Rockets will revolutionize air travel!"

Plane rolls sideways upon takeoff and explodes.

While docking to a space station

"Well this is coming along nicely."

Moments later a spent large orange tank collided with the station and destroyed about ten hours work.

My mother likes to ask how my Kerbals are coming along and I told her about my prelaunch checklist fairly early on. Now she likes to ask if I fully covered my checklist. Every time she asks I have to add a new item. It started with just three things. SAS enabled, engines throttled up, epic music playlist started.

1. "Did you cover your checklist?" "Yeah, the launch is great so far." *add "confirm staging configuration."

2. "Did you cover your checklist?" "Yeah, everything is properly staged and I'm about to launch." *add "is ship adequately strutted?"

3. "Is your ship falling apart again?" "No, no. I'm just about into orbit and... everything exploded." *add "test launch with probe before losing a brave kerbonaut*

4. "Did you cover your checklist?" "Yes! Everything is great, I'm circularizing, Everything looks great." *add "confirm placement of batteries and solar panels." For the test probe.

5. "Have you actually finished that checklist?" "I don't know. I hope so." * add "docking parts should be facing outward." (Note: this was my first attempt at docking and I figured the different sides would connect [like magnets] and not the same sides.

Since those early days (last week) I've since added landing gear, parachutes, extra SAS components, RCS components, and science equipment (because I once had a completely successful launch with nothing to show for it). I've become very nervous whenever she asks me about my checklist. I develop a sense of impending doom.
"I'm sure I have enough fuel left" seems to be a recurring theme

"I'm just going to push this the rest of the way." - Usually muttered when transferring from munar orbit to a kerbin aerobrake after the fuel has run out.

'Pushing' requires EVA-ing and using EVA propellant to get the rest of the delta V. I usually end up running out of EVA propellant and have to send a rescue mission for the lander and the kerbal...

This method is also known as 'Using the force'.

"Hey whys the ground coming up so fast?! BOOOOOOOM!" Landing with ASL...

"Lets test out this new spaceplane!" Jeb testing a SSTO

"WEEEEEEEEE" Jeb on a SRB after the spaceplane incident.

"I'll just respawn, right... RIGHT???" Bob breaking the fourth wall to reassure himself
I'm sure I can land on that canyon over there.
Flying a plane on Layhte ...no fuel left in the tanks....500m above ground : "Pull Up , Pull Up , Pull Up" with a voice of Google translator

Have you tried more power?

Not yet because more power = more weight, but now I will. Because I have a launcher which is two stage to orbit with 4000-5000 Delta V left afterwards. It each stage has about 1.80 thrust to weight ratio.

Here it is:

"This should have plenty of fuel for a Moho mission" and an hour later I am watching the last fumes get used up while still on a Moho escape.

Edit: One other thing I frequently find myself saying: "The fuel seems to be draining asymmetrically" - seconds later one engine flames out while the other rips the ship apart.

Edited December 30, 2013 by Merinsan

"Plenty of dV, nice and light...Ion engines can't be that bad!"

*1 hour of 4x physics warp later*

"Tylo, you win"

I decided to get into orbit around all 5 moons of Jool using ion engined probes released from a small 'mothership'. Needless to say I gave up and made a more powerful rocket.

"We'll worry about landing when we're in orbit"

"I assure you, this is totally safe."
